meanings.definition: Continuous physical force exerted on or against an object.
meanings.sent1: The pressure of the water against the dam was strong.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic applied pressure to the wrench to tighten the bolt.
meanings.sent3: Feeling the pressure of the heavy rain, the umbrella turned inside out.
meanings.sent4: Under the pressure of the wind, the tree branches swayed back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The pressure of the hammer against the nail made a loud sound.

meanings.definition: The use of persuasion, influence, or intimidation to make someone do something.
meanings.sent1: She used pressure to convince her friend to join the dance class.
meanings.sent2: The company applied pressure on the employees to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The pressure from the sales team made the customer buy the product.
meanings.sent4: Under the pressure of his friends, he finally agreed to go camping.
meanings.sent5: The pressure from the coach motivated the team to win the game.

meanings.definition: The feeling of stress or urgency caused by a demanding situation.
meanings.sent1: The pressure of the upcoming exam made her study harder.
meanings.sent2: He felt pressure to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The pressure of choosing the right gift for her mom was overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: Under the pressure of the competition, he performed his best.
meanings.sent5: The pressure of the job interview made him nervous.
